clinical_study.brief_title: Improvement of Facial Nerve Monitoring in Parotid Surgery by Sugammadex
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Sugammadex on Facial Nerve Monitoring in Parotid Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the effectiveness of rapid reversal of rocuronium-induced neuromuscular block by sugammadex during IONM of facial nerve during parotid surgery

detailed_description.textblock: Intraoperative neuromonitoring (IONM) of facial nerve has been applied in identifying and preserving facial nerve during parotid surgery. In this setting, even a single dose of nondepolarizing muscle relaxant may lead to delayed and weakened electromyography (EMG) signal in facial nerve monitoring during parotid surgery. The aim of this study was to investigate the effectiveness of rapid reversal of rocuronium-induced neuromuscular block by sugammadex during IONM of facial nerve during parotid surgery

primary_outcome.measure: evoked EMG amplitude of facial nerve

arm_group.description: did not receive muscle relaxant during anesthesia
received single dose of rocuronium for anesthesia and sugammadex at skin incision

intervention.description: single dose of sugammadex at skin incision

study_pop.textblock: adult patient with facial nerve monitoring undergoing parotid surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- undergoing parotid surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- facial nerve injury, renal failure, liver cirrhosis, neuromuscular disease

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital
